TopicTitle: Life goal: Achieved! (To fly in a helicopter!)

Articles.Content:
Yes i'm pretty pleased with myself now!

yes, there are more important things I got to worry about, but it's nice to have a break from my troubles every now and then, SPECIALLY when it envolves something as cool as a free helicopter ride!

so far I have flown in all types of aircraft and rode in a glorious assortment of various sea and land vehicles - still, helicopter was high on my "do before you die" list

and yesterday, I got a chance! - I can only say: It IS every bit as awesome as I expected to be, and then a little more!!

here's me just after a 45 minute flight of awesome!

and then I got to shoot a video of the Agusta you see in the picture (that was my ride) plus a Bell 407 taking off side by side shortly afterwards

http://youtu.be/s2ZzBAWEbEw

Alas for me, I didn't get to fly back home in the chopper as well; That was the deal that earned me the free ride, to drive back my step-dad's car down the traffic-jammed mountain road that leads in and out of this popular winter holiday spot (those who live in the SÃƒÂ£o Paulo, Brazil area probably know already where this is) as he and my mother (same mother as Harvester's) would return with his ÃƒÂ¼ber-rich cousin aboard this more optimal means of transportation - The drive back took me over 3 hours...

but it was totally worth it!!!

that dumb smile on my face still hasn't completely gone! - what a ride!
Woohoo! Well done Moach, that's pretty amazing
Moach you are officially more of a Boss!!!
damn you beat my recently achieved life goal of flying a glider (only 2000 more minutes of gliding to go until i go go solo LOL)

I know how it feels. It's such a good feeling when you finally get to do the one thing you really have always wanted to do.

On spring break my family went to Disney World in Florida and I finally got to drive an Aston Martin when we were there. Isn't it just he best feeling afterwards? That smile and giddy feeling doesn't leave you for days afterwards.
